question:
Some people believe that everyone has a right to have access to university education and that governments should make it free for all students no matter what financial background they have. 
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
text: It may seem that many programs in higher education have many tuition fees. Nevertheless, some people believe that it should a basic privilege, regardless of socioeconomic background. In this essay, I absolutely agree with this statement. Besides, I will provide the reasons and the sampler from my experience.

Owning the fact that the country is developed efficiently by the brilliant person who graduated with a bachelor degree. Hence, this is an opportunity for increasing the intelligent personnel. According to abrogation tuition, the learner can admission to the college easier than an expensive payment. For example, after teenagers had graduated from high school, they were not anxious about being outgoing for their course. In addition, it is a fundamental advantage that everyone must receive. Therefore, someone who lives in the country can study in university equally under financial conditions such as a citizen who cannot spend at a high rate.

On the one hand, the Ministry of Education should allocate more budget in order to support free tuition policy for all students. Firstly, the financial aspect impacts some people to lose their chance because they cannot pay the fee. For instance, some students who grow up in poor families cannot afford a private university. Subsequently, they will postpone until they are ready. Furthermore, parents are helped by this statement because they do not work hard for the tuition. In this situation, in a not wealthy family is not crucial to do an extra job for gaining more income to expense.

In conclusion, although the university courses have an expensive outlay, the government should authorize it unpaid for everyone and every financial status. If they launch this condition, all people will desire to entrance more than the past times.
